alert.note: Alert for Denton (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 30 at 7:56PM CDT until August 30 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR SOUTHEASTERN DENTON COUNTY... At 756 PM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen across Central and Southern Denton County, with isolated higher amounts between 3 and 5 inches having been recorded between Flower Mound and Highland Village. Additional rainfall amounts of up to a half inch are possible across the warning area through mid evening. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Frisco, Denton, Lewisville, Flower Mound, Grapevine, The Colony, Southlake, Corinth, Highland Village, Trophy Club, Lake Dallas, Lake Lewisville, Little Elm, Roanoke, Argyle, Hickory Creek, Double Oak, Shady Shores, Northlake and Cross Roads. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
